lib/path.c File Reference

Detailed Description

This file contains function managing the searching path for files, behaves as PATH in POSIX systemsx.

Function Documentation

void rmpath ( const char *  path  ) 

Remove a directory from path. 

00046                              {
00047     char *abspath=myabspath(path);
00048     PATH_T *ia,*ib=NULL;
00049     for(ia=PATH;ia;ia=ia->next){
00050     if(!strcmp(ia->path,abspath)){
00051         if(ib){
00052         ib->next=ia->next;
00053         }else{
00054         PATH=ia->next;
00055         }
00056         free(ia->path);
00057         break;
00058     }
00059     ib=ia;
00060     }
00061     if(!ia){
00062     warning("%s not foun idn PATH\n",path);
00063     }
00064     free(abspath);
00065 }

Try to find a file in path and return its absolute filename of exist, NULL otherwise.

00094     char *fnout=NULL;
00095     if(exist(fn)){
00096     fnout=strdup(fn);
00097     }else{
00098     PATH_T *ia;
00099     char fntmp[PATH_MAX];
00100     for(ia=PATH;ia;ia=ia->next){
00101         strcpy(fntmp,ia->path);
00102         if(strlen(ia->path)>0 && fntmp[strlen(ia->path)-1]!='/') 
00103         strcat(fntmp,"/");
00104         strcat(fntmp,fn);
00105         if(exist(fntmp)){
00106         fnout=strdup(fntmp);
00107         break;
00108         }
00109     }
00110     }
00111     return fnout;
00112 }

char* find_file ( const char *  fn  ) 

Locate a file in path and return its absolute filename.

Will emit error if not found. 

00117                                {
00118     char *fnout=search_file(fn);

00120     info("File is %s\n",fnout);
00121     printpath();
00122     error("Unable to find file %s.\n",fn);
00123     return NULL;
